video.name: BAKED ALOO GOBI - Indian Spiced Potato Caulilflower | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Baked Aloo Gobi – Indian Spiced Potato Cauliflower Side. 10 Mins Active time!
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2019/01/baked-aloo-gobi-vegan-recipe.html
MY BOOKS: https://veganricha.com/books

Aloo Gobi is the quintessential part of an Indian spread. Spiced, perfectly cooked bites of potato and cauliflower, often served along with dals, curries. Aloo gobi is made almost exactly the same way at my mom’s since forever. No one wants to mess with perfection! Everyday Aloo Gobi is a seasoned veggie side kind of dish. It is dryish and not saucy. Restaurants usually make a saucy version. Try this one for saucy aloo gobi https://www.veganricha.com/2017/08/instant-pot-aloo-gobi-curried-potato-cauliflower.html

Back to our fave Punjabi Aloo gobi. I kept the flavors and ingredients and changed up the cooking in the skillet to baking and voila. The process is much easier and needs less active time, as you don’t need to be in standing the kitchen.

Also the baked aloo gobi turns out fabulously flavored, perfectly cooked and no mushy Cauliflower! Aloo Gobi in my house has got to be dry evenly spiced side without a sauce. Its wet enough from the moisture in the veggies. Just a few ingredients and gorgeous golden veggies is what we are aiming for.  You can change up the spices to preference. For less roasted crisp, just use a smaller baking dish so they are spread almost double layer. Believe me, you wont go back to the skillet or Instant pot for aloo gobi once you try this Roasted Aloo Gobi! 

Same Amazing Indian flavor and excellent texture. Vegan Glutenfree Soyfree Nutfree Recipe. See Tips to bake the veggies to your preference on the post. 

Music by Joakim Karud
youtube.com/joakimkarud

recipeIngredient: 1  small head of cauliflower (, 2 heaping cups)
2  medium potatoes ((yukon gold or white), about 2 cups cubed)
1 tsp ground cumin ((1/2 tsp if you dont like cumin))
1 tsp ground coriander (, optional, but nice)
1/2  tsp garam masala ( or curry powder or berbere(1/2 to 1 tsp to preference), or use more of ground cumin and coriander)
1 tbsp minced ginger (, (1 inch ginger minced))
1 tbsp minced garlic or 1 tsp garlic powder
cilantro and lemon juice for garnish
Other flavor additions: 1/2 tsp amchur(dry mango powder), 1/2 tsp dried fenugreek leaves(kasoori methi), a good pinch of asafetida (hing)

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the cauliflower into small florets and put in a large bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Chop the cauliflower into small florets and put in a large bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Chop the potatoes into small cubes (less than 1/2 inch) and add to the bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Chop the potatoes into small cubes (less than 1/2 inch) and add to the bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl. Mix the 1/2 tsp turmeric and the rest of the ingredients under spicing until well combined. Add the spice mixture to the large bowl and toss to coat.Alternatively, Add the minced ginger, garlic, oil to the bowl and toss well. Combine the turmeric, cumin, coriander, garam masala, cayenne, salt in a small bowl, mix well. Sprinkle over the cauliflower, potatoes and toss well.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl. Mix the 1/2 tsp turmeric and the rest of the ingredients under spicing until well combined. Add the spice mixture to the large bowl and toss to coat.Alternatively, Add the minced ginger, garlic, oil to the bowl and toss well. Combine the turmeric, cumin, coriander, garam masala, cayenne, salt in a small bowl, mix well. Sprinkle over the cauliflower, potatoes and toss well.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the cauliflower and potatoes sit for a minute. Sprinkle some more turmeric and mix lightly (optional).
recipeInstructions.name: Let the cauliflower and potatoes sit for a minute. Sprinkle some more turmeric and mix lightly (optional).

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the veggies in a stoneware or ceramic baking dish. Spray oil. See Tips above on how to spread the veggies and pan size to choose.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread the veggies in a stoneware or ceramic baking dish. Spray oil. See Tips above on how to spread the veggies and pan size to choose.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 400 deg F (204 C) for 20 mins, then cover with parchment and bake for another 15 mins or until tender to preference. Taste carefully and adjust salt and spice and mix in. garnish with cilantro and some lemon juice.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 400 deg F (204 C) for 20 mins, then cover with parchment and bake for another 15 mins or until tender to preference. Taste carefully and adjust salt and spice and mix in. garnish with cilantro and some lemon juice.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot with dals, curries, flatbread. Perfect side to chana masala or butter tofu.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve hot with dals, curries, flatbread. Perfect side to chana masala or butter tofu.
